main-category.main-info: When it comes to your health information, you have certain rights. This section explains your rights and some of our responsibilities to help you.

sub-category.sub-title: Get an electronic or paper copy of your medical record

sub-description: You can ask to see or get an electronic or paper copy of your medical record and other health information we have about you. Ask us how to do this.

We will provide a copy or a summary of your health information, usually within 30 
				days of your request. We may charge a reasonable, cost-based fee.

sub-category.sub-title: Ask us to correct your medical record

sub-description:
You can ask us to correct health information about you that you think is incorrect 
				or incomplete. Ask us how to do this.
We may say “no” to your request, but we’ll tell you why in writing within 60 days.

main-category.main-info:
For certain health information, you can tell us your choices about what we share. If you have a clear preference for how we share your information in the situations described below, talk to us. Tell us what you want us to do, and we will follow 
		your instructions.

sub-category.sub-title: In these cases, you have both the right and choice to tell us to

sub-description: Share information with your family, close friends, or others involved in your care
Share information in a disaster relief situation
Include your information in a hospital directory

sub-category.additional-info:
If you are not able to tell us your preference, for example if you are unconscious, 
			we may go ahead and share your information if we believe it is in your best interest. 
			We may also share your information when needed to lessen a serious and imminent 
			threat to health or safety

sub-category.sub-title: In these cases we never share your information unless you give us written permission

sub-info.sub-description:
We may contact you for fundraising efforts, but you can tell us not to 
				contact you again.

main-category.main-info: How do we typically use or share your health information?

sub-info.sub-description: We can use your health information and share it with other professionals who are treating you.
sub-info.sub-example: A doctor treating you for an injury asks another doctor about your overall health condition.

sub-info.sub-description: We can use and share your health information to run our practice, improve your care, and contact you when necessary
sub-info.sub-example: We use health information about you to manage your treatment and services.

sub-info.sub-description: We can use and share your health information to bill and get payment from health plans or other entities.
sub-info.sub-example: We give information about you to your health insurance plan so it will pay for your services.

sub-category.sub-title: Help with public health and safety issues

sub-info.sub-description: We can share health information about you for certain situations such as:

list-item: Reporting suspected abuse, neglect, or domestic violence
Preventing or reducing a serious threat to anyone’s health or safety
